data.title: High CPU overload after update to VSCode 1.14.0
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Just open a project. (even without extensions) and Code Helper CPU usage goes too high.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: **Yes**

Arguments of Code Helper process:
```sh
/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/out/utils/electronForkStart /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js --useSingleInferredProject --enableTelemetry --cancellationPipeName /var/folders/c_/gkwddkyn6vs5nkj9cyvf0m8w0000gn/T/vscode-tscancellation-aefeee28373a85d83ef1.sock* --npmLocation "/usr/local/bin/npm"
```

EDIT: Also, Code Helper will not quit after quitting VSCode. I have to force-kill everytime.

```` while `div#app>(div>p#test*2)*2` incorrectly expands to: ````html

data.title: HTML saving as RHTML
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40, 2017-07-10T18:36:31.751Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none
---

Usually, when I save HTML files in Visual Studio Code they save as the type HTML. So, when I open the files in my file explorer, I have an option to "Open with Google Chrome" and I can see my HTML page from there in the browser (or any other browser I choose). However, when I updated to the most recent version of Visual Studio Code, whenever I save my HTML files they save in the type of RHTML. When they are in this type, I can not preview/render them with any browser. I need help to get my files to save as HTML files, and not RHTML files so I can actually use Visual Studio Code.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create any HTML file with any content.
2. Save the file (in my experience it will save as RHTML).

data.title: Cannot connect to debugger (--inspector flag)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: 10.12.5
- Node: 8.1.2
- Chrome 59
Steps to Reproduce:

1. `node --inspect=0.0.0.0:9229 index.js`

```
Debugger listening on ws://0.0.0.0:9229/...
For help see https://nodejs.org/en/docs/inspector
```

contents of launch.json
```
{
 
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
      
        {

            "type": "node",
            "protocol": "inspector",
            "request": "attach",
            "name": "Attach to Process",
            "address": "0.0.0.0",
            "port": 9229
        }
    ]
}
```

2. start debugger in VS Code. Stalls for a while then:

`Ensure Node was launched with --inspect. Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 0.0.0.0:9229).`

NOTE:
Inspector connects when using Chrome, `chrome://inspect` detects the node and stops at break points as expected.

data.title: 1.14 Window Hangs Upon Opening
data.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15745278/28094826-e54cf8be-6653-11e7-8c29-919e91d90d36.png)


- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: Mac OS Sierra 10.12.5
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Upgrade to 1.14
2. Use the editor for a few minutes

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

At the moment I am gathering more data as to what extensions it might be colliding with, when I run
it with `code --disable-extensions` it starts, but when I open a project it still crashes. The bug only affects the window, I can still interact with the running process by successfully getting the about window to display.

data.title: Any Git operations requiring credentials no longer work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40, 2017-07-10T20:36:40.018Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-83-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
githistory|don|0.2.1
godot-tools|gee|0.2.7
cpptools|ms-|0.12.0

(1 theme extensions excluded)

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

---

VSCode would display a prompt asking for my credentials whenever interacting with a private repo of mine, but with this new update that prompt no longer appears, making the repo unusable. It's worth noting that these operations still work fine via the terminal (both external and vscode's built-in).

---

To reproduce this, try to execute a Git operation that would typically ask for credentials. For example:
 * Push some changes to a repo
 * Interact with a private repo
   * Cloning
   * Pushing/pulling
   * etc. 
 
Doing the latter (pushing to a private repo) gives me these error messages under OUTPUT:
```
fatal: cannot exec '/usr/share/code/resources/app/extensions/git/out/askpass.sh': Permission denied
fatal: could not read Password for 'https://[nope]@bitbucket.org': No such device or address
```

Probably worth noting that attempting to clone my private repo gives me this error prompt at the top:
```
Git: Cloning into '/home/user/Repositories/test-repo'...
```
And no logs under OUTPUT.

data.title: Show/Hide `Running Tasks` StatusBar
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows

The new `Running Tasks` item in the StatusBar is show even for _Empty Folders/Workspaces_ or Folders/Workspaces that don't have any `.vscode/tasks.json` defined.

It's a great addition to have this new StatusBar item available 👍  , but I think that it should be hidden if the opened Folder/Workspace don't have any task available, or maybe a `User Setting` to decide if/when it is shown/hidden.

Thanks

data.title: CodeLens Popup: Ghosting/Overflow into panel when resized
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.14.0 - OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601 Problem: The code lens hover view overflows/partially ghosts into panel when panel resized with keyboard command Increase View Size. It does not matter which panel output or terminal is visible. Steps to reproduce: - open code with code in editor and panel visible - hover over some code to get popup - focus on terminal with keyboard - expand panel vertically with keyboard - popup will ghost into panel without a border - see before-and-after screenshots ![hover overflow 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25272315/28093541-b65d201c-6665-11e7-9eb0-663515788811.png) ![hover overflow 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25272315/28093563-d274dbaa-6665-11e7-9144-472f766b8bba.png)

data.title: Folding should persist by file, not tab-only
data.body:
I don't use the tab-view, I use the pane-view in vscode. When closing out of a file on the left pane and opening it later on the right pane, all the code folding is lost. This is annoying because I like to keep my code folded for easy scanning. It would be nice if this feature persisted for files, not pane/tabs only.

Thanks :)

data.title: Terminal: No re-layout, some truncation on panel resize
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.14.0 - OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601 Problem: The integrated terminal does not re-layout when views change such as adding the sidebar. The wrapped output will stay wrapped or get truncated. Steps to reproduce: - open code with no terminal - display the sidebar - start an integrated terminal - size the terminals to force some wrapping - generate output with some longer lines - force the terminal panel to expand by hiding the sidebar - panel expands but terminal does not re-layout ![terminal wrapping](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25272315/28092601-05501aca-6662-11e7-85db-e3b1c109718a.png)

data.title: Terminal: Duplicate shell startup lines
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.14.0 - OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601 Problem: In certain codes to sizes opening a new Windows integrated terminal will show duplicate shell startup lines. The problem seems associated with the code window size. For instance A half screen docked code window with the activity and sidebar visible is more likely to show the problem, but as the left side screenshot shows even without the sidebar it's possible to happen sometimes. The problem seems to also happen on the first terminal launch. Steps to reproduce: - open code with no terminal - dock code or size to half screen - display sidebar - increases probability of Problem - open new integrated terminal - observe duplicates startup lines (see screenshot) ![terminal duplicate lines](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25272315/28091607-77655ad4-665e-11e7-99ee-112c6ca0022c.png)

data.title: Monokai Dimmed syntax highlighting is different - with less distinctions
data.body:
With the update today, this syntax highlighting for Monokai Dimmed for javascript (babel) changed pretty drastically, eliminating a lot of distinctions between the text.

Most noticeably, most of text is an ugly white...  which I am used to a light blue (numbers maintain the blue). Template strings have variables still in green, like the rest of the string.  Properties on variables are just white, like the variables, not purple like they used to be.

Keywords are like `class`,` extends` and `new`, are still the same, methods are still orange, booleans are still pink.  It used to be that the keyword `this` was the only white text and now it is red like `global`, `window`, and `Promise`.

Not sure what happened, but I was very used to this theme and now I feel like I am reading something very unnatural.  I hope it is just a bug, and not that this will be the decision to eliminate those distinctions above.

data.title: Copying and moving breakpoints

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Would be nice to have the possibility to copy or/and move a breakpoint from a line to another one. 
This is very important especially when we use the conditional breakpoints, a new one needs rewriting the whole condition.
